intro: Phanera pyrrhoneura, commonly known as the red-veined phanera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
